TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE criminal charges were brought against the applicant for dissemination of anti - NORP propaganda . On DATE the police searched his home and confiscated certain items – a radio , audio records , books , newspaper clippings and manuscripts – which he had allegedly used in his unlawful activity .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that the applicant was not guilty on the ground of insanity and ordered him to be placed in a mental asylum .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE found that the applicant 's mental health had improved and that he could be released .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a statement to acknowledge that the applicant had been unlawfully persecuted by the ORG . The applicant was reinstated in his rights .

CARDINAL . NORP In the course of DATE the applicant made several unsuccessful attempts to recover the property that had been confiscated in DATE . His requests to prosecutors ' offices and the organisations then in possession of the property were rejected .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought a claim for repossession against ORG and ORG of the Voluntary Society for Assistance to the ORG , ORG and ORG . He also brought a claim for damages against ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE granted the applicant 's claims in part and ordered ORG to pay the applicant MONEY ( RUR ) compensation and RUR CARDINAL by way of legal costs . On appeal , the judgment was upheld by ORG of ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted a writ of execution in respect of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE to the registry of ORG .

CARDINAL . He was not notified in time whether enforcement proceedings had been opened , or what action had been taken to execute the judgment . For this reason , he issued proceedings against the bailiff in charge of the execution . On DATE ORG found in the applicant 's favour , holding that the bailiff had acted unlawfully . The applicant was also informed that responsibility for enforcement of the judgment had been passed to a different bailiff 's service – ORG of Orenburg .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued clarification on how its judgment of CARDINAL DATE was to be enforced . It confirmed that , even though ORG was the defendant in the case , the compensation should be recovered from ORG – the authority liable for debts of ORG . The applicant appealed , insisting that the debtor 's bank account details should be included in the operative part of the judgment to make the enforcement easier . The appeal was dismissed on DATE .

CARDINAL . As no progress was made in the enforcement proceedings , on an unspecified date the applicant issued fresh professional negligence proceedings against the bailiff . On DATE ORG of Orenburg examined the complaint and dismissed it . It found that the bailiff had lawfully stayed the enforcement proceedings because an acting Public Prosecutor of the Orenburg Region had initiated supervisory - review of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . The court stated that under national law , enforcement could be stayed pending supervisory review . The applicant 's appeal was dismissed on DATE by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff attempted to attach the accounts of ORG . ORG challenged the bailiff 's actions in court . The complaint was granted by ORG of Orenburg on DATE . The court concluded that the seizure of the ORG 's assets had been unlawful because , according to the clarifications provided on CARDINAL DATE concerning the enforcement , the debt should have been recovered from the ORG of GPE . The applicant had not been aware of these proceedings , and was not summoned to the hearing . He successfully raised this point on appeal to ORG . The decision of DATE was quashed and a fresh examination of the case was ordered .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused the applicant 's application to have the judgment enforced in a different way . His appeal against that decision was dismissed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff stayed the enforcement proceedings because ORG had requested supervisory - review of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant learned that the President of ORG had stayed the execution because the supervisory - review of the judgment of DATE had been in progress . The applicant lodged a complaint against the President , which was dismissed on DATE by ORG of GPE as not amenable to judicial review . The applicant was later informed that the stay of execution had been lifted .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Senior Bailiff of ORG decided that the execution should be stopped as the writ of execution did not unequivocally identify the debtor . The applicant successfully appealed against this decision : on DATE ORG of Orenburg held that ORG had exceeded her authority when she closed the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff responsible for the applicant 's file revoked her decision of CARDINAL DATE commencing the enforcement since the writ of execution did not clearly identify the debtor and its address . The applicant successfully complained to ORG about this decision : on DATE the court ordered the bailiff to proceed with the execution of the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the same court ruled that the stay of execution pending the supervisory review was unlawful and ordered the bailiff to continue the execution .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff applied to ORG for clarification as to how the judgment should be enforced , what legislation should be applied and which accounts of which branch of ORG should be charged . The court did not satisfy the bailiff 's request as the writ of execution was sufficiently clear , and the court had no competence to advise the bailiff on possible modes of enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the acting Public Prosecutor of the Orenburg Region lodged an application for supervisory review of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE on the ground that the compensation should have been awarded against ORG and not against ORG . On DATE the Presidium of ORG granted the prosecutor 's application and quashed the judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE . The case was remitted for a new examination .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG of PERSON refused ORG application to lift the attachment of its accounts . Instead , the court ordered that the execution should cease since the judgment debt had been quashed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave a new judgment in the case . The applicant was awarded ORG in compensation for the property and ORG in legal costs . The compensation was to be paid by the financial department of ORG . The claims for repossession and non - pecuniary damages were dismissed . The applicant 's appeal against the judgment was disallowed by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff closed the enforcement proceedings because the award had been credited to the applicant 's bank account on DATE . The applicant challenged this decision in court claiming that he had not received the money . On DATE the NORP ORG established that there was insufficient evidence that the award had indeed been paid to the applicant and annulled the bailiff 's decision to close the enforcement .
CARDINAL . NORP By letter of DATE the Government informed the ORG that the award of DATE had been paid to the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . By letter of DATE the applicant informed the ORG that he had not received the money awarded .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE provides that a bailiff 's order on the institution of enforcement proceedings must fix a time - limit for the defendant 's voluntary compliance with a writ of execution . The time - limit may not exceed DATE . The bailiff must also warn the defendant that coercive action will follow , should the defendant fail to comply with the time - limit .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of the PERSON , the enforcement proceedings should be completed within DATE of the receipt of the writ of enforcement by the bailiff .
